Query_DeleteDialogContent: Are you sure you want to delete this query?
Query_UpdateFailed_Content:
Failed saving Query. fix the following errors and try again:
    {{error}}
Query_Manager_NoDataFound: Click Add to define a query
Series_DeleteDialogContent: Are you sure you want to delete this serie?
Variables_DeleteDialogContent: Are you sure you want to delete this variable?
Variables_Description:
Define input parameters which are sent from the host container.
 These variables are used in the queries filter.
Series_Description: Define the queries that generate the aggregated data.
LabelFormatDescription1: Define the format of the data label.
LabelFormatDescription2: Unique value is required when having two series with the same dynamic series field.
LabelFormatDescription3: You can add text to a dynamic series value using the ${label} variable, for example: 'ser1: ${label}'
DynamicSeriesDescriptions: Generate a seperate graph per each field value
CategoriesDescription: Defines the X-Axis values. For date based charts, usually it is defined in the Action Date field
Series_NoDataFound: Click Add to define a series
Variables_NoDataFound: Click Add to define a variable
PreviewNoSeriesDefined: Preview will be shown after adding a series
ScriptParametersDescription: The script can contain the aggregation parametes in the convention of 'params.'+parameter name.
ScriptParametersDescriptionExample: For example, to get an average of the total sales per account, define:
ScriptParametersDescriptionExampleOne: script parameter in the sum of GrandTotal
ScriptParametersDescriptionExampleTwo: script parameter in the distinc count of account ID
DynamicFilterDescription: Define the fields which if changed by the user, will be added to the chart filter
LimitNumberOfResultsDescription: Limit the number of returned result, for example to show the top 10 selling items.
Accounts_Of_Users_Under_My_Role: Accounts of users under my role
DATA_EXPORT_DESCRIPTION:
View the data of a specific series in a specific category in order to understand the aggregated results.
Fill in the values to filter the data.
SeriesExistsTitle: Series with this name already exists
USER_FILTER_DESC1: Choose a user to show the preview data for a specific user.
USER_FILTER_DESC2: Choose None to use the current user.
USER_FILTER_DESC3: Note that if a user is selected, then the configuration of
USER_FILTER_DESC4: the account and user filter is ignored.
